Description:
Living Large 925sqm block with side access!
Set at the end of a quiet street is this quality built Dennis Family home. Only 4 years old this meticulously cared for home offers a calm and serene outlook and more than enough space for the growing family.
Upon arriving you will find the entrance to be very welcoming. The main bedroom is just off to the right, a spacious retreat with 2 generous walk in robes and a luxurious ensuite featuring twin vanities, plenty of storage, a huge shower and separate toilet. The remaining three bedrooms each include built in robes and are also of a terrific size! One even offers direct walk through access to the central bathroom which includes a bath and separate shower. In addition to the family bathroom is a separate powder room.
The living space on offer allows for extreme functionality, there are two separate living areas, both of a terrific size! The main is just off the kitchen and dining area making day to day living, dining and entertaining an absolute breeze!
The stylish kitchen is equipped with a 900mm oven and cook top, a dishwasher, lots of cupboard space and a big pantry. The laundry is also conveniently located with great under bench storage and side yard access. Just off the dining area are glass sliding doors flowing straight onto the undercover entertaining spaces the ideal spot to sit and enjoy a coffee or accommodate & entertain friends and family!
This home also includes a split system for cooling, ducted gas heating and beautiful timber laminate flooring throughout.
Externally also has much to offer, the large low maintenance yard is completely enclosed and includes a garden shed for storage, as well as a timber decked entertaining area. There is side gate access, with more than enough space for an additional 3 cars/a boat/or caravan. The double lockup garage offers internal access.
Located on a great 925sqm (approx) allotment and only seconds to all of White Hills amenities this family home is a must to inspect. The Bendigo CBD is also only 5 minutes away and all schools and sporting facilities are close by. Dont delay inspecting, contact the agent today!
Insights: 11 other 4 bedroom house in White Hills have recently been sold.

Description:
Fabulous Location Perfect Down sizer
This well located three bedroom home will certainly appeal to those buyers currently looking to down size or get into the market for the first time. The brick veneer home comprises of three good sized bedrooms, large master with ensuite & walk in robe offers privacy, two separate living areas, good size kitchen meals, with access to the outdoor entertaining area, with two bathrooms, comfortable heating and cooling throughout, compact low maintenance garden with established trees, small storage, single carport. With Schools, White Hills Football Oval, recreation, shops either within walking distance or a short drive all adding to the convenience. With solid beginnings, move in now, add your own personal touches throughout and make this opportunity your next family home.

Description:
Superb 3 Bedroom Home in White Hills
FURTHER PRICE REDUCTION (FROM $309,900 DOWN TO $290,000 FOR QUICK SALE)
This wonderfully presented, 3 bedroom property is the perfect place to settle a family. With its low maintenance and secure yard, ample storage and great undercover entertainment area opening out from the large lounge, this is the ideal place to call 'home'. Featuring a double carport, ensuite, gas hot water and heating, gas cooking and evaporative cooling, this property not only offers all the mod cons but also economy and efficiency. Located close to the exquisite White Hills Botanical Gardens and central to shops and schools, this wonderful home is everything you're looking for.

Description:
DELIGHTFUL HOME IN A GREAT FAMILY AREA
The bones of this home are great, it's a rendered brick, with a tiled roof and offers 3 generous bedrooms (all with BIRs), a large kitchen with lots of cupboard space, a corner pantry, a separate formal lounge, a bright, light filled bathroom plus a large laundry. Year round comfort is controlled via ducted gas heating throughout, a large gas heater and a spilt system in the lounge. At the rear of the home we find a large rumpus room with siding door access to a paved undercover alfresco area. This area also leads you to a delightful backyard, with rustic landscaping and a cottage garden – perfect for relaxing. Off street parking is secure, with double gate access to a large 4 car garage/workshop and a separate workshop.To complete the home you have a single lean-to car port, a covered BBQ area and a bird aviary. All of this on a large 1036m2 block, with a new rear color bond fence to be installed shortly. Located in a great position with schools, shop, walking tracks and major shopping centres all within minutes away.
Insights: 32 Raglan Street, White Hills VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 40 other 3 bedroom house in White Hills have recently been sold.

Address: Cnr Lamperd Lane & Heinz Street White Hills VIC 3550
Description:
Live, work and play
This very versatile lifestyle property has something for everyone – it's ideal for big or blended families, tradies, work-from-home types or horse enthusiasts.
Set on approximately 9430 square metres (2.5 acres), the brick homestead-style residence includes formal lounge and dining room with bay window, four good-sized bedrooms, two bathrooms, large open-plan family living room, country-style solid-timber kitchen featuring granite bench tops, pantry, electric cooking and spacious adjoining meals area. Cosy solid fuel heating supplemented by several split system units throughout the residence ensures year-round internal temperature control.
Outside, the full-length rear verandah doubles as an alfresco area and the fenced rear yard keeps toddlers or pets secured while shady trees and established gardens surround the sparkling 9 metre in-ground pool in the front garden.
A handy home office/bungalow with two air-conditioned rooms, toilet and carport makes the perfect retreat for teens or extended family members, guest lodge/studio or workplace for hairdresser, masseur etc.
House your horses and gear in the 10 x 18 metre shed. It's currently fitted with six stables but could easily be converted to a great workshop with side sliding door access with a lean-to on the side including another stable and parking for floats, trailers, caravans etc.
The property is serviced by town water and a 3.2 megalitre water right with a tree-lined seasonal creek on one boundary and a dam in the back corner.
A unique opportunity to secure a relaxed, semi-rural lifestyle located opposite the Bendigo Racecourse, walking distance to school and bus stop and only about an eight-minute drive to the CBD.

Description:
PRESENTATION, POSITION AND POTENTIAL
VENDOR KEEN TO SELL - MAKE AN OFFER!
This one has all the P's – position, presentation and potential.
A reluctant sale by original, proud owner, it presents a perfect opportunity to owner-occupy, invest and/or develop the substantial block.
The quality-built two-bedroom, two-bathroom home features a full-length front verandah and formal entry hall leading to a spacious lounge with adjoining dining and kitchen. All-electric kitchen has a dishwasher, ample cabinetry, breakfast bar for casual meals and access to a rear, full-length covered pergola complete with gas barbecue.
The oversized main bedroom incorporates a large ensuite, double robes and sweater cupboard while a sliding door to the pergola lets the cool evening breezes circulate during summer complementing ducted evaporative cooling.
Winter chills are kept at bay by gas-ducted heating plus a brick fireplace in the lounge with gas heater insert for when the weather is just a bit on the cool side.
Outside is a double garage and low maintenance landscaping. The fully fenced, level block of approximately 1,000 square metres has a wide driveway providing good subdivision potential.
Conveniently located one block from Napier Street bus stop and shops including pharmacy, Post office, Bendigo Bank branch and bakery with the Botanical Gardens and schools a little further afield.
Insights: 24 Raglan Street, White Hills VIC 3550 was last sold in 2017 and 9 other 2 bedroom house in White Hills have recently been sold.

Description:
FOR THE DEVOTED HORSE ENTHUSIAST - HERE IT IS!
Offering an exceptional lifestyle, land opportunity. Located on approximately: 3,652 sq.m of prime land, with direct rear access to the Bendigo Jockey Club Racecourse, and only minutes to drive to the city centre. This property comes with everything the horse lover requires and more.
-A small home office on site features one bedroom & bathroom with kitchen / laundry facilities. This requires some cosmetic renovating, but is very handy infrastructure on this site with a carport attached.
-Large shed (27m X 14m approx) including (X8) individual bays & mounting yard undercover & large feed room.
-Five day paddocks.
-Garden storage shed (2.5m X 3m approx) with concrete floor.
-Cosmetically renovate / extend the property, or simply use as an office to be on site with the animals, where you can capitalise on this wonderful opportunity this property has to offer.
The property is ideally suited for the Horse Enthusiast. Prominently located, this will make a fabulous investment for now and in the future.

Description:
Jewel in the Crown
Our owners along with the residents of this idyllic location know just how convenient it is to live here in this quiet peaceful court settling amongst quality homes. Oozing modern style and offering discerning buyers a host of up to the minute features.
The chef friendly bright open kitchen features a gas cook top, electric oven, stainless steel dish washer, ideal for all the family events and just meters via its sliding door opening onto an impressive large out door BBQ area for all year round entertaining.
Contemporary open plan lounge and dinning with large windows facing the rear yard that give it a real country atmosphere with its several large natives.
Comprising 3 spacious bedrooms the homes main bedroom has walk in robe and en-suite, whilst the main bathroom includes a spa bath upon entry it looks like it’s never been used.
The home has gas central heating plus an additional reverse cycle Air Con in the lounge area.
There is a Single garage with remote roller door and the property has a second concrete driveway for extra parking. This immaculate home a true credit to its owners.
There are so many amazing facilities & attractions nearby that are just minutes away, here are just a few; White hills Swimming pool, Botanical Gardens, Primary school, don’t miss the location quality and affordability this one has it all be first to see and buy this fantastic house so you can call it your home.
For your private inspection, contact Rod Jones now

Description:
PERIOD HOME WITH AMAZING SPACES
This might look like a sweet Victorian period-style home from the street but inside it has been extended and enhanced to create a spacious five-bedroom family home with multiple living areas.
The woven wire fence, oak trees, pretty garden and picture-perfect white facade are indicative of more charming features found inside.
Under the bull-nosed verandah, the high-waisted front door with lead-light sidelights opens to a traditional centre hallway with high, timber lined ceilings and timber fretwork.
Off the hall, the front sitting room includes an open fireplace with timber surround and mantlepiece. It is followed by two bedrooms, both with built-in robes, and a large lounge room before the hallway opens into a vestibule/sunroom with access to the bathroom, laundry and a third bedroom.
Large, remodelled country-style kitchen includes timber-lined ceiling, brick fireplace with IXL wood stove, gas cooker, dishwasher, ceiling fan and ample cabinetry. Cork-look floor tiles flow through to adjoining spacious family room with split system air conditioner, under-stair storage and double sliding doors to external pergolas for outdoor living.
A side entrance from the return verandah opens to the lounge room where a staircase leads to two first floor bedrooms, both with robes and leafy garden outlooks.
The block measures over 2000 square metres (approximately Â½ acre) with a convenient second frontage to Kennewell Street, 6m x 9m shed, garden shed, fruit trees and good Colorbond fencing.
The setting is like a little piece of the country in suburbia with lots of open space and the White Hills Football and Netball grounds opposite with the beautiful Bendigo Botanical Gardens, schools, local pub and public transport within easy walking distance.
Insights: 54 Scott Street, White Hills VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 2 other 5 bedroom house in White Hills have recently been sold.

Description:
Big on Value, Small on Price!
If you are looking for a peaceful location not too far from town, White Hills may be just the location.
Busy family buyers will love this spacious home on a manageable 605m2 allotment.
Alfresco entertaining under the covered pergola and the low maintenance back yard is perfect for weekend fun.
This home comprises of three bedrooms, a home office/study three living areas and two bathrooms along with a massive rumpus room, all of which are a generous size and allow flexibility of use. Laminated timber flooring runs throughout most of the home with carpet in the office and several bedrooms. The kitchen and family living area is centrally situated and is more than equipped to cater for the largest party with masses of cupboard, bench space and generous pantry.
Ducted evaporative cooling and ducted gas heating provide year round comfort, solar hot water.
1.5KW 8 Panel Solar System with a 29c feed in tariff, are practical extras.
Walk the kids to school and yourself to work, with access to the Bendigo creek trail through the back gate. 5 minute drive to the CBD and a multitude of amenities, schools, shops, doctors, public transport all within minutes.
Even though this home is so close to town, the location of the property offers privacy and a sense of being away from it all. This, plus its other many features, will only be fully appreciated by viewing it for yourself - you'll be happy you did.
Wes Dorrington : 0433 013 687

Description:
Fab family home only awaits fresh updates
Perfectly situated to suit fast-paced family life, this sturdy brick home awaits your inspiration to transform it into your dream home. Entirely original (or so it seems), the interior is in quite well-kept condition, requiring not much more than cosmetic updates unless redesign is preferred.
Family-friendly, a fab floorplan encompasses 2 large living zones parted by a dining room, with all 3 also able to accommodate a study area. In the spacious kitchen, a gas stove and dishwasher are functional if not modern. Plenty of cabinetry joins many other built-in cupboards to provide abundant storage throughout the home.
Central to 4 bedrooms, a separate shower off the laundry plus dual access bathroom and toilet assist with busy mornings and evening bath, brushing and bedtime routines. Current climate control options consist of reverse cycle split system, gas wall furnace, gas space heater and a box air-conditioner.
Positioned on a classic almost 1/4 acre (approximately 967m2) corner allotment allows ample space for outdoor activities. Accessed from indoors by several French doors, alfresco living has several sheltered areas on offer and established gardens are equipped with a watering system. A double carport attached to the house can secure vehicles behind tall gates and a garden shed can store tools and bikes.
A block away, picnic or BBQ at Botanic Gardens and swimming pool for relaxing family outings. Only a few doors from primary and pre-schools, local shops and cafes are also close handy. A nearby walking track as well as bus stops between Epsom and Bendigo lead to Weeroona College, shopping centres and a variety of services. Positioned to please and simply loaded with potential, all this address needs is refreshing with an infusion of your personal style.
Matt Gretgrix : 0438 911 688

Description:
Space To Suit The Growing Family!
This home defines family living complete with 4 fabulous bedrooms with built in robes, main with walk through robe and ensuite, study & 2 bathrooms, 2 living rooms designed to create zoned areas catering to the needs of the entire family. Enjoy 2 split systems for heating & cooling, plus a gas log fire in the family room. 2 garages plus a caravan port with its own side access & additional parking behind privacy gates & a standard of living on offer which is very appealing.
Stylishly updated, this delightful residence provides a serene setting for modern living, an alfresco entertaining area on a substantial 1500m2 approx allotment, close to Botanical gardens, pre, primary & secondary schools and public transport. Expect the unexpected with the spacious open plan living-dining-kitchen. The kitchen has been updated and is fitted with quality appliances. The dining opens out to a covered and paved alfresco with ceiling fans, mains gas BBQ and fernery. Veggie patches, mini orchard, ample shedding & secure rear yard. 16 panel 4kW solar power back to the grid, water tank with pump for the established gardens. This surprising family lifestyle property needs to be visited to be appreciated!

Description:
Neat home and a huge block
This 1980’s brick home sits on an enormous 2,655 m2 (approx.) block in two allotments. Zoned general residential, there is certainly potential in its current 2 lot configuration however a variety of options are at your disposal, given the easement within Lot 2 and all STCA of course. Alternatively, you may just wish to have a solid home on a huge block!
The neutral colour palette and new carpeting allows potential purchasers to either move straight in or add this low maintenance property to their investment portfolio.
The entrance hall leads immediately into the large living-dining area with decorative cornicing and a free standing solid fuel heater. The highly functional kitchen flows directly off the dining area and includes a double sink and new upright Chef gas cooker.
The three bedrooms, all with built in robes, are located to the rear of the property off a central hallway. The hallway can be closed off from the living zone to minimise noise to the bedrooms at night. The bedrooms are serviced by a large family bathroom with bath, shower, vanity and toilet. For convenience, a separate toilet is also provided off the laundry.
The block includes a double carport and large 6m x 6m shed with concrete floor and power. A smaller 3m x 3m garden shed provides additional storage options.
Located in walking distance to Weeroona Secondary College and Lake Weeroona and only a short drive to the Bendigo CBD, White Hills shops and the new Village Epsom. This is an opportunity not to be missed.

Description:
SUCH A CHARMER - HELLO VICTORIAN
What an attractive facade and from front to back you will be very impressed! This four bedroom family home is sizeable, suitably renovated to provide comfort for the entire family. The extension blends seamlessly retaining charming characteristics and period features.
- Large corner allotment over 1,000 sq.m, tradies will love and appreciate the easy access into the shed / garage rough gates from street.
- Large master bedroom with ensuite and built in robes.
- Three additional large bedrooms, two of which contain built in robes, the third is currently setup as a study, or optional fourth bedroom.
- Wide hallway with timber flooring & high ceilings, two separate living areas with large front lounge.
- Large open plan meals and timber kitchen, access to the laundry from here with separate toilet & access to outside alfresco.
- Ornate fireplace, open fireplace, solid fuel heater in the front lounge, split system at the rear, ducted has heating and ducted evaporative cooling. All of your heating and cooling wants and needs are well and truly covered.
- Entertaining
is a dream with undercover alfresco decking
plus delightful outside paved area for those balmy summer nights, sitting by your own wood fire pizza oven.
- The “Man Cave” is completing the package with additional toilet and shower, concrete flooring and power with bar already setup.
- Water tanks, lemon tree, solar power and above ground pool are also notable features.
Agent Remarks: Nothing to do but move in and enjoy the beautiful warmth and energy of this much loved family residence.
Matt Pinniger : 0438395713

Description:
CLASSIC CREAM BRICK HOME
Perfect for a first home buyer or a great investment opportunity.
- Formal front lounge.
- High ceilings.
- Three bedrooms.
- Generous kitchen/dining.
- Polished pine flooring.
- Ducted heating.
- Refurbished bathroom.
- Lovely rear garden.
- Brick shed, 2 car garage and carport.
Situated in a quiet court with easy access to walking tracks, secondary schools and childcare with a bus going to the city on the highway.

Description:
What a place to start
Set at the end of beautiful Cahill Street White Hills on a generous 460m2 allotment, is this fantastic home which would be such a perfect place to start.
Comprising of:
- 2 bedrooms with ample storage
- 2 separate living areas or 3rd bedroom if required
- Newly renovated kitchen & modern bathroom
- Separate laundry & toilet
- Large alfresco/entertaining area with ceiling fan
- 2 x large sheds, one with air-conditioning and the other converted into a children's play room
- Ducted heating and cooling ensuring all year round comfort
This affordable home is located in the ever popular White Hills. Next to the walking track which takes you into the Bendigo CBD, passing a Primary School, High School and only a stone's throw from public transport and all the amenities White Hills has to offer. Get in quick.
Matt Pinniger : 0438395713

Description:
Ready Made Investment
Come and inspect this modern, three year old, two bedroom brick unit. Walking distance to Holy Rosary School, Botanical Gardens and 5km drive to Bendigo CBD and 3km to Epsom Village, provides convenient town living. It includes a light and airy open plan living space, two good size bedrooms, with WIR to master and two way bathroom, low maintenance courtyard, split system and single garage with direct internal access. An excellent investment currently let at $280 per week till May 2017
